page.title: 15Industry in N.W.Guildford
page.content: With the exception of Hestair Dennis, who made{fire engines,}most of the industry is light and confined to five small industrial estates. These are situated in the southern part. Much of the industry is concerned with{modern technology}and includes electrical and electronic goods manufacture. There is also a firm making computer hardware (diskdrives) and another making software. Three firms deal in{glass,}one making lenses, another windscreens, and the third safety glass. In addition to two timber yards, there is also a manufacturer of door and window frames. Two other traditional firms are a forge and a tentmakers. The remaining three companies surveyed make welding equipment, confectionery and needlecraft goods.
